intro: Linosyris villosa, commonly known as the hairy linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Linosyris villosa is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
